concept.title: Modularization and integration of design
concept.shortdesc: Specialization hierarchies are implemented as sets of vocabulary modules, each of which declares the markup and entities that are unique to a specialization.

conbody.p: The separation of the markup vocabulary and its implementing declarations into modules makes it easy to extend the hierarchy, because new modules can be added without affecting existing document types. It also makes it easy to assemble design elements from different sources into a single integrated document type shell and makes it easy to reuse specific parts of the specialization hierarchy in more than one document type shell.
